'''Yolanda Ivonne Montes Farrington''', January 3, 1932, [[Spokane, Washington]]) is an [[exotic dancer]] and actress of the [[Cinema of Mexico]]. In Mexico she is considered the principal exotic dancer along KalantÃ¡n, Bongala and [[Su Muy Key]]. Tongolele became a professional dancer when she was only 15 years old. Her father was [[Spain|Spanish]]/[[Sweden|Swedish]], her mother [[France|French]]/[[England|English]] and her maternal grandmother was of [[Tahiti]]an descent. She starred in several films from the 1940s through the 1980s but most people remember her from the classic 1971 film ''[[Isle of the Snake People]]'' starring [[Boris Karloff]] in one of his last roles. Tongolele is still active in television, theatre, and nightclubs.
